intro: Hitchenia, commonly known as the false hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the Malvaceae family. It consists of several species native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and the Americas. The plants typically have palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant blooms and attractive foliage. Hitchenia species are generally drought-tolerant and thrive in well-drained soils.
